learning.title: Choosing the Right Chart for the Story

questions.promptMd: Which chart best shows distribution differences across segments?

answers.contentMd: Small multiples of histograms (or box plots) by segment

answers.feedbackMd: Better for composition over time; not distribution.

questions.promptMd: True or False: For comparisons, bars outperform pies because length is easier to compare than angles.

answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Bars are more accurate for comparing categories.
Pies are harder to compare precisely.

questions.promptMd: Which misuse MOST risks misleading the audience?

answers.contentMd: Truncated y‑axis that exaggerates small differences
answers.feedbackMd: Common distortion—avoid unless clearly justified and labeled.

questions.promptMd: True or False: Small multiples can replace cluttered legends and support comparisons.

answers.feedbackMd: Correct. They reduce eye travel and aid comparison.
